column2: Laws governing the right of a ruler to interfere in the ownership and succession of hereditary titles.
The ruler is not under any circumstances allowed to interfere in the ownership and succession of hereditary titles.
The ruler is allowed to legally seize hereditary titles from traitors and unlawful subjects. Vassal title inheritance is regulated to disallow a title to pass to another realm.
The ruler is allowed to legally seize any hereditary titles independantly of circumstances. Vassal title inheritance is regulated to disallow a title to pass to another realm.
